meanings.sent1: She spoke illiterately, struggling to read the simple instructions.
meanings.sent2: He illiterately stumbled through the book, unable to understand the words.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to read the newspaper illiterately, but ended up knocking over the coffee mug.
meanings.sent4: The wind howled illiterately through the trees, as if trying to decipher their ancient language.
meanings.sent5: The child illiterately traced the letters on the page, hoping to unlock their meaning.

meanings.definition: Without the ability to read or write
meanings.sent1: The illiterately written note was full of misspelled words.
meanings.sent2: She felt illiterately lost in the library, surrounded by books she couldn't understand.
meanings.sent3: The illiterately drawn map led them in circles, confusing rather than guiding.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt illiterately closed off from the world of words and stories.
meanings.sent5: The illiterately scrawled graffiti on the wall made it hard to decipher the message.
